required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Post Marketing Surveillance on Long Term Drug Use of GIOTRIF Tablets in Patients With Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Mutation-positive Inoperable or Recurrent Non-small Cell Lung Cancer.

brief_summary.textblock: In Japan, post-approval execution of post marketing surveillance (PMS) is requested by the Japanese Pharmaceutical Affairs Law (J-PAL) in order to accumulate safety and efficacy data for reexamination. Reexamination period is defined by J-PAL. Eight years after approval of a new substance, results of PMS need to be submitted as a part of reexamination dossier to the Japanese regulatory authority, the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (MHLW).

primary_outcome.time_frame: From first drug administration until 28 days after the last drug administration, up to 52 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: This outcome measure presents incidence of adverse drug reactions (ADRs). An ADR was defined as an AE if either the investigator or the sponsor (or both) assessed the causal relationship to GIOTRIF® Tablets either as "Yes", "Probably yes" or "Can't be denied". The number of patients with Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs): "Malignant progression" reported as ADRs were included.

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective Overall Response Based on Physician's Assessment [According to RECIST Version 1.1]
secondary_outcome.description: Objective overall response based on investigator's assessment (according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1) for target lesions and assessed by MRI: complete response (CR) is the disappearance of all target lesions, a partial response (PR) is defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the target lesion and stable disease (SD) is defined as fitting the criteria neither for progressive disease (PD) nor a PR. The population included the Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor [TKI]-naïve patients and the TKI pre-treated patients. Overall response was calculated with 95% Clopper-Pearson confidence interval. OR = (CR+PR)/(CR+PR+SD+PD+Unknown)*100.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Patients with Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) mutation-positive inoperable or recurrent non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)will be included.
Exclusion criteria:
- None

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Case Report Form (CRF) collected for 1605 patients, 1602 added in safety set. 1 patient excluded due to out of contract period, 1 due to no treatment (with GIOTRIF) and 1 patient received (GIOTRIF) treatment before registration (total 3 patients excluded from the safety set). Participant flow is based on safety set.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This was a non-interventional, prospective, observational, single arm study based on new data collection.

group.title: Afatinib Dimaleate
group.description: The patients were administered single daily dose of Afatinib dimaleate tablet (GIOTRIF® Tablets), starting at 40 milligram (mg) orally up to a period of 52 weeks. The dosage might be adjusted according to the patient's tolerability, with a maximum daily dose of 50 mg.

participants_list.participants: Patients received treatment of GIOTRIF® Tablets
Completed is defined as 52 weeks follow-up after starting administration of GIOTRIF® tablets.

baseline.population: Safety Set: This analysis set included all patients who had received treatment of GIOTRIF® tablets except those who were found not following registration rules, invalid contract or previous treatment experience with GIOTRIF® tablets.

group.title: Afatinib Dimaleate
group.description: The patients were administered single daily dose of Afatinib dimaleate tablet (GIOTRIF® Tablets), starting at 40 milligram (mg) orally up to a period of 52 weeks. The dosage might be adjusted according to the patient's tolerability, with a maximum daily dose of 50 mg.

outcome.title: Incidence of Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs)
outcome.description: This outcome measure presents incidence of adverse drug reactions (ADRs). An ADR was defined as an AE if either the investigator or the sponsor (or both) assessed the causal relationship to GIOTRIF® Tablets either as "Yes", "Probably yes" or "Can't be denied". The number of patients with Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs): "Malignant progression" reported as ADRs were included.
outcome.time_frame: From first drug administration until 28 days after the last drug administration, up to 52 weeks.
outcome.population: Safety Set: This analysis set included all patients who had received treatment of GIOTRIF® tablets except those who were found not following registration rules, invalid contract or previous treatment experience with GIOTRIF® tablets.

group.title: Afatinib Dimaleate
group.description: The patients were administered single daily dose of Afatinib dimaleate tablet (GIOTRIF® Tablets), starting at 40 milligram (mg) orally up to a period of 52 weeks. The dosage might be adjusted according to the patient's tolerability, with a maximum daily dose of 50 mg.

measure.title: Incidence of Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs)
measure.description: This outcome measure presents incidence of adverse drug reactions (ADRs). An ADR was defined as an AE if either the investigator or the sponsor (or both) assessed the causal relationship to GIOTRIF® Tablets either as "Yes", "Probably yes" or "Can't be denied". The number of patients with Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs): "Malignant progression" reported as ADRs were included.
measure.population: Safety Set: This analysis set included all patients who had received treatment of GIOTRIF® tablets except those who were found not following registration rules, invalid contract or previous treatment experience with GIOTRIF® tablets.

outcome.title: Objective Overall Response Based on Physician's Assessment [According to RECIST Version 1.1]
outcome.description: Objective overall response based on investigator's assessment (according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1) for target lesions and assessed by MRI: complete response (CR) is the disappearance of all target lesions, a partial response (PR) is defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the target lesion and stable disease (SD) is defined as fitting the criteria neither for progressive disease (PD) nor a PR. The population included the Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor [TKI]-naïve patients and the TKI pre-treated patients. Overall response was calculated with 95% Clopper-Pearson confidence interval. OR = (CR+PR)/(CR+PR+SD+PD+Unknown)*100.
outcome.population: Efficacy Set: This analysis set was a subset of the safety set, which included all patients in the safety set except those who had no available tumour assessment and/or who did not suffer from Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) mutation-positive inoperable or recurrent Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC).

group.title: Afatinib Dimaleate
group.description: The patients were administered single daily dose of Afatinib dimaleate tablet (GIOTRIF® Tablets), starting at 40 milligram (mg) orally up to a period of 52 weeks. The dosage might be adjusted according to the patient's tolerability, with a maximum daily dose of 50 mg.

measure.title: Objective Overall Response Based on Physician's Assessment [According to RECIST Version 1.1]
measure.description: Objective overall response based on investigator's assessment (according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1) for target lesions and assessed by MRI: complete response (CR) is the disappearance of all target lesions, a partial response (PR) is defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the target lesion and stable disease (SD) is defined as fitting the criteria neither for progressive disease (PD) nor a PR. The population included the Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor [TKI]-naïve patients and the TKI pre-treated patients. Overall response was calculated with 95% Clopper-Pearson confidence interval. OR = (CR+PR)/(CR+PR+SD+PD+Unknown)*100.
measure.population: Efficacy Set: This analysis set was a subset of the safety set, which included all patients in the safety set except those who had no available tumour assessment and/or who did not suffer from Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) mutation-positive inoperable or recurrent Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC).

reported_events.time_frame: From first drug administration until 28 days after the last drug administration, up to 52 weeks.
reported_events.desc: The number of participants presented in “Serious Adverse Events” and “Other Adverse Events” includes subjects with progressive disease.

group.title: Afatinib Dimaleate
group.description: The patients were administered single daily dose of Afatinib dimaleate tablet (GIOTRIF® Tablets), starting at 40 milligram (mg) orally up to a period of 52 weeks. The dosage might be adjusted according to the patient's tolerability, with a maximum daily dose of 50 mg.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The general scientific objective of this non-interventional study was to obtain an estimate of occurrence of AEs in the population under study. This study did not include a comparator, hindering the ability to this real world data into perspective.
